title: Facebook to settle with SEC after probe into privacy practices
text: The settlement could see Facebook fined over $100 million, The Wall Street Journal reports.

title: The Wall Street Journal: Facebook set to pay fine of more than $100 million to settle SEC investigation
text: The Securities and Exchange Commission is expected to announce a settlement with Facebook Inc.

title: The Big Tech antitrust investigation may be a political game, but that doesn’t mean it will end quickly
text: Bigger inquiry seems to be politically motivated, but will put cloud over Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google for many months at least.

title: Facebook may create privacy committee as part of FTC settlement
text: Yahoo Finance panel discusses Facebook advertising and privacy issues.

title: Facebook's Zuckerberg will reportedly shoulder personal responsibility for privacy issues
text: A settlement between the FTC and Facebook is expected on Wednesday.

title: The Wall Street Journal: Zuckerberg must personally certify Facebook’s compliance with FTC under settlement
text: WASHINGTON — Facebook Inc. CEO Mark Zuckerberg will have to personally certify that the company is following federal officials’ orders for protecting consumer privacy under a settlement expected to be announced with the Federal Trade Commission on Wednesday, a person familiar with the matter said.

title: Earnings Watch: Earnings Watch: Facebook’s fine, Boeing’s bind and Tesla’s bottom line
text: Last quarter, Boeing Co., Facebook Inc. and Tesla Inc. played “Hold my beer” amid controversies; three months later, it is time for an update as they work through their issues.

title: U.S. Opens Antitrust Probe of Big Tech Over Competition Harm
text: The U.S. Department of Justice said its antitrust division will look at concerns that consumers, businesses and entrepreneurs have expressed about search, social media, and online retail, according to a statement Tuesday. Lerer Hippeau Ventures Managing Director Eric Hippeau and Center for Democracy and Technology Vice President of Policy Chris Calabrese discuss the fallout on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Facebook and OpenStreetMaps empower the mapping community with AI-enhanced tools
text: If we're going to map the world, we're not going to do it with ever-greater volumes of elbow grease. There's just too much work to do.

title: U.S. Justice Department launches antitrust review of big tech firms
text: The U.S. Justice Department said on Tuesday it was opening an investigation of major digital tech firms on whether they engage in anticompetitive practices.

title: Justice Department Opens Antitrust Review of Big Tech Companies
text: The agency said it would look into concerns about anticompetitive behavior by some of the industry’s biggest companies.

title: House antitrust chair ‘troubled’ by tech hearing, sends letters demanding clarity from Amazon, Facebook and Google
text: Amazon, Facebook, and Google might have finished their testimony at last week’s antitrust hearing, but the House Judiciary Committee isn’t letting them out of the hot seat.

title: Breaking: DOJ to open broad antitrust review of big tech companies
text: CNBC's Ylan Mui joins "Closing Bell" to report the U.S. Department of Justice's plan to open an antitrust inquiry into big tech companies and its effect on FANG stocks.

title: Tech shares fall as U.S. finally admits it is investigating Big Tech for antitrust
text: Apple, Amazon, Facebook and Google stocks decline in after-hours trading following announcement from Justice Department.

title: Apple, Amazon, Facebook and Alphabet shares dip after new antitrust inquiry reported
text: Shares in the largest tech companies in the U.S. took a hit in after-hours trading Tuesday afternoon, following a report that a new antitrust investigation has begun by the Department of Justice.

title: DOJ reportedly to open broad antitrust review of Big Tech; tech stocks dip
text: The U.S. Department of Justice launches fresh antitrust examinations against Apple, Amazon, Google and Facebook.

title: Facebook agrees to pay $5bn in vast privacy settlement, insiders say
text: FTC to claim company misled users about handling of their phone numbers as part of settlement

title: Facebook And Twitter Earnings: Social Media Takes The Stage
text: Amid of one of the busiest weeks of earnings season, social media takes center stage as Facebook and Twitter prepare to open their books.

title: Facebook’s $5 Billion FTC Settlement Settles Nothing
text: For years, Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ:FB) has weathered tremendous regulatory and political pressure.

title: Facebook to create privacy panel, pay $5 billion to U.S. to settle allegations
text: The Federal Trade Commission is set to announce on Wednesday that Facebook Inc  has agreed to a sweeping settlement of significant allegations it mishandled user privacy and pay $5 billion, two people briefed on the matter said.

title: Facebook to settle FTC privacy allegations, adopt new policies: sources
text: The Federal Trade Commission is set to announce on Wednesday that Facebook Inc  has agreed to a sweeping settlement of allegations it mishandled user privacy and pay roughly $5 billion, two people briefed on the matter said.

title: Facebook Earnings Set To Arrive As Stock Hovers In Buy Zone
text: Facebook earnings are set to arrive after the market close Wednesday. Facebook stock is still in buy range, after rising above its 198.58 buy point from a cup-with-handle base on July 9.

title: Facebook Users Are Clicking More Ads
text: Time spent in News Feed is increasingly valuable for both users and Facebook.

title: Capitol Report: Facebook tops Amazon and Google in second-quarter lobbying spending
text: Facebook Inc. shelled out $4.1 million on lobbying Washington in the second quarter, topping the outlays by other so-called FAANG companies and keeping the tech giant on pace for another record year of spending to influence lawmakers and regulators.

title: Facebook Likely to Beat in Q2: 9 ETFs to Buy
text: These ETFs would be the potential movers if Facebook comes up with a positive earnings surprise.

title: Can Facebook Continue To Defy Headwinds And Churn Out An Earnings Beat In Q2?
text: Facebook reports Q2 earnings on July 24. In Q1, the company had beat consensus expectations for revenue and earnings.

title: Facebook warns flaw in Messenger Kids app let children chat with strangers
text: A "technical error" in the app meant it was possible for a child to enter a group chat with friends-of-friends who hadn't been approved by their parents.

title: The Best Earnings Charts: Facebook
text: The social media and FAANG stocks are set to shake up the market this week with their earnings reports.

title: FB Stock Could Surge If It Does These 3 Things
text: Fortunately for investors of the social network, Facebook has numerous other ways of making money off its 2.7 billion users. Here are three ways FB stock could surge without drawing too much ire from regulators.

title: Facebook and Amazon lead tech lobbying spend as antitrust scrutiny mounts
text: New disclosures show Facebook and Amazon each spent more than $4 million on lobbying activity in the second quarter of 2019.

title: Why Facebook (FB) Might Surprise This Earnings Season
text: Facebook (FB) is seeing favorable earnings estimate revision activity and has a positive Zacks Earnings ESP heading into earnings season.

title: Big Tech Earnings This Week: Facebook, Amazon, and Alphabet
text: Here's what to watch when the social media, e-commerce, and search engine titans report their Q2 earnings starting on Wednesday.

title: Facebook fails to keep Messenger Kids’ safety promise
text: Facebook’s messaging app for under 13s, Messenger Kids — which launched two years ago pledging a “private” chat space for kids to talk with contacts specifically approved by their parents — has run into an embarrassing safety issue. The Verge obtained messages sent by Facebook to an unknown number of parents of users of the […]
